title: Ticket #6868: scitokens: users cannot list or delete their own tokens
description:
Users need to have a way to list or delete their own tokens from the SEC_CREDENTIAL_DIRECTORY (KRB or OAUTH). The condor_store_cred tool already has a delete option, but it's not clear how to use it, or if it even works for this case.

Would be nice to have something like: 

$ condor_store_cred delete box
condor_store_cred: Removed box tokens for user jpatton
remarks:
2020-Jan-07 11:23:23 by jpatton:
Bumping this. We don't necessarily need to piggyback off condor_store_cred. Maybe something following what Brian's done with the condor_token tools would be good here.
2020-Apr-10 07:42:27 by tim:
Bulk change of target version from v080808 to v080809 using ticket-target-mover.

2020-Apr-22 10:24:02 by johnkn:
condor_store_cred can sort of do this now, does it need more work?

2020-Apr-22 10:29:45 by zmiller:
Yeah, that's true and that is cool. Let me try it out before I see if we are "done" with it. Maybe it does this already but it would be nice to display any meta-information we can. However, since the creds are basically a black box, though, all I can really think of is "last time updated" from the file timestamp (and size, like anyone would really care? md5sum? :)

Jason, is there a .meta file for each cred? Or is that info only in the "token request" that gets cleaned up after acquiring?

Anyhow, like I said let me poke at it a bit.

2020-Apr-22 10:32:23 by jpatton:
The meta file is created by the credmon as a persistent store of metadata, and it does stick around. I think I have code in the credmon that deletes orphaned meta files, but I should check to be sure and add code if this doesn't exist. So I don't care if condor_store_cred deletes it or not.

2020-Apr-26 11:32:02 by zmiller:
Making this a code enhancement for 8.9.X series since that's where all TJ's new credential infrastucture changes for KRB/OAuth live.

2020-Jun-29 11:21:44 by zmiller:
This "kind of" exists now, in 8.9.7 and 8.9.8.

You can do the following: 

condor_store_cred query-oauth
condor_store_cred delete-oauth

and those both work, but it's "all or nothing". You can list all your OAuth tokens, and delete all your OAuth tokens. However, to manage an individual token, you would want to use the "-s" flag to condor_store_cred, and after a quick test it seems that is not yet supported so a little more work is necessary there.

We would also like to display some data from the ".meta" file associated with an OAuth token when the user does a query-oauth command (with or without specifying a particular service).

To better track where code lands, I made new tickets for the new items: #7775 and #7776.
